metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1058 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way Postgresql allowed a user to modify the behavior of a query for other users. An attacker with a user account could use this flaw to execute code with the permissions of superuser in the database. Versions 9.3 through 10 are affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1058` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.3-1
libecpg6 - 10.3-1
libpgtypes3 - 10.3-1
libpq5 - 10.3-1
postgresql-10 - 10.3-1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.3-1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.3-1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.3-1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.3-1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.3-1').
